value.title: Facebook, Twitter and other social media companies need to be treated like Big Tobacco
value.excerpt: For the first time, the U.S. surgeon general has declared the barrage of misinformation spreading on social media a public health hazard. value.title: Biden's Executive Order on Promoting Competition in the American Economy
value.excerpt: This complex and wide-ranging executive order from President Biden proposes actions to promote competition across a wide range of American industries.

value.title: Learning aids: New method helps train computer vision algorithms on limited data
value.excerpt: Researchers from Skoltech have found a way to help computer vision algorithms process satellite images of the Earth more accurately, even with very limited data for training. This will make various remote sensing tasks easier for machines and ultimately the people who use their data.

value.title: Why Transformers offer more than meets the eye
value.excerpt: Transformers, a major innovation in AI and machine learning, have practical real-world applications -- and implications.

value.title: Why we need engineers who study ethics as much as maths
value.excerpt: The Miami apartment collapse is a grim reminder of why engineering matters, and why comprehensive education in ethics should be embedded in the training of engineers.

value.title: Native Voice nabs $14M to convert devices into branded voice assistants
value.excerpt: Native Voice, a company developing an SDK that allows companies to bring branded voice assistants to devices, has raised $14 million.

value.title: What Happens When Robots Make Fake News?
value.excerpt: Writing created by artificial intelligence has dramatically improved over the last few years. Such robot-generated text is now used in newsrooms as well as by companies looking to generate content quickly and cheaply.

value.title: eBay taps computer vision to transform online shopping

value.title: Researchers match DeepMind’s AlphaFold2 protein folding power with faster, freely available model
value.excerpt: DeepMind stunned the biology world late last year when its AlphaFold2 AI model predicted the structure of proteins (a common and very difficult problem) so accurately that many declared the decades-old problem “solved.

value.title: Culture Eats AI Self-Driving Cars For Lunch

value.title: Feeding the machine: We give an AI some headlines and see what it does
value.excerpt: Initially, I saw two possible approaches to training an algorithm to get a probability of any given headline's success: Binary classification: We simply determine what the probability is of the headline falling into the "win" or "lose" column based on previous winners and losers.

value.title: China grants tax breaks, policy leeway to turn Shanghai into powerhouse for AI, chips, planes and pharmaceuticals
value.excerpt: China’s central government has offered tax incentives, greater autonomy in local legislation and more administrative power to liberalise the capital markets in Shanghai, as Beijing envisions building Pudong into a ‘brilliant pearl’ of a strong socialist country.

value.title: Opening Up the Email Marketing Engine to Artificial Intelligence
value.excerpt: With an average open email rate of 18.0% in 2020, it’s not like marketing teams are crushing this email thing. Wait, isn't 18% pretty good? We get that standards are low here, for sure. Bottom-line? Email remains a priority.

value.title: How Artificial Intelligence Is Fighting Wildfires
value.excerpt: A lab at the University of California, San Diego, uses data to figure out how fires will burn, and how to help prevent them.

value.title: ‘An Algorithm Found You’: How Data Determines Price Tags for Films and Finds New Talent
value.excerpt: Like every production company, Jumpcut wants to discover new talent. As a data-driven startup, it leans on machine-learning algorithms to analyze content on YouTube and Reddit — everything from production value to the emotional response of commenters — and spits out a list of prospective content creators.

value.title: AI-Based Chatbots Speed Up Intelligent Talent Recruitment
value.excerpt: Intelligent chatbots are proving that there’s no talent shortage when you know how to personalize employee recruitment.

value.title: Smart Cities: How Facial Recognition Can Facilitate The Safe Return To Urban Life
value.excerpt: When deployed correctly and used to its highest potential, facial recognition technology can help facilitate safe interactions and support a flourishing economy.
